item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection. (text: CR H47)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.(text: CR H47)
The previous question was ordered without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 11.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H47-63)

summary.text: Expresses the condolences of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Robert T. Matsui, former Representative from California. Authorizes the Speaker of the House to appoint a committee of the House to join with such Members of the Senate to attend the funeral services.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Expresses the condolences of the House of Representatives on the death of the Honorable Robert T. Matsui, former Representative from California. Authorizes the Speaker of the House to appoint a committee of the House to join with such Members of the Senate to attend the funeral services.

bill.title: Expressing profound sorrow on the occasion of the death of the Honorable Robert T. Matsui, a Representative from the State of California.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
